alert.note: Alert for Andrew; Daviess; DeKalb; Gentry; Harrison; Nodaway; Worth (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 12:11AM CDT until June 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Worth County in northwestern Missouri... Northwestern Daviess County in north central Missouri... Gentry County in northwestern Missouri... Southwestern Harrison County in north central Missouri... Southeastern Nodaway County in northwestern Missouri... Southeastern Andrew County in northwestern Missouri... DeKalb County in northwestern Missouri... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 1209 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Ravenwood to 9 miles southwest of Stanberry to Savannah, moving east at 45 mph. Another severe storm was in Gentry County near Ford City. This storm is moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cameron, Savannah, Albany, Stanberry, Maysville, King City, Ravenwood, Union Star, Pattonsburg, Amazonia, New Hampton, Clarksdale, Conception Junction, Parnell, Rosendale, Cosby, Darlington, Weatherby, Mcfall and Guilford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 62 and 67, and between mile markers 72 and 79. Interstate 29 between mile markers 56 and 61. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Andrew; Daviess; DeKalb; Gentry; Harrison; Nodaway; Worth
